name: Blackland Neighborhood Center
description: This center is off MLK behind the UT baseball stadium, Disch-Falk Field. The nearest buses are #18, 20, and 322. If you need food assistance, call the center at 512-972-5790 for curbside pick-up or home delivery to see if you qualify.

name: Community First! Village
description: Community First! Village is a 51-acre master planned community that provides affordable, permanent housing and a supportive community for men and women coming out of chronic homelessness. A development of Mobile Loaves & Fishes, this transformative residential program exists to love and serve our neighbors who have been living on the streets, while also empowering the surrounding community into a lifestyle of service with the homeless.

name: Foundation Communities - The Jordan at Mueller
description: 1st and 3rd Tuesday: 11:00 am-1:00 pm  Monday - Friday: 3:00 pm-5:00 pm (Kids Cafe ONLY). Monday - Friday this is also a Kids Cafe site, where children attending after school programs at area schools can also get free, nutritious meals. Sites are open to kids and teens age 18 and younger.

name: YWCA Greater Austin
description:
The YWCA Counseling and Referral Center (YWCRC) serves the community by offering trauma-informed, multi-lingual, multicultural services for individuals, couples, families, youth and groups. Services provided include mental health therapy and support, consultation referrals to Care Coordination, life skills and personal empowerment programs, and professional development training.
*TELEHEALTH SERVICES AVAILABLE*

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: SAFE Alliance
description: Supports survivors of child abuse, sexual assault and exploitation, and domestic violence.  SAFE Alliance offers a wide variety of help to people being abused, including emergency shelters, transitional housing and counseling services. Call the 24-hour hotline at (512) 267-7233 or text (737) 888-7233.

name: Hand-washing & Porta-Potty - Parking lot on Red River St.
description: handwashing stations and Port-a-Potties that can be used any time of day

name: The Austin Shelter for Women and Children
description: The Austin Shelter for Women and Children (ASWC) is a low barrier, housing- focused emergency shelter serving women and dependent children experiencing homelessness. Case management, rapid rehousing services, employment assistance, a computer learning lab, child care, and child/family therapy are provided on-site. In partnership with the City of Austin, The Salvation Army has operated ASWC since 2001.

name: Vivent Health
description: Vivent Health provides free; Behavioral & Mental Healthcare, Pharmacy, Food Pantry, Substance Abuse Treatment, Medical Care, HIV/STI Testing & Treatment, Lifepoint Needle Exchange, Case Management, Housing, Nutrition, and Dental Services, PrEP

name: Hand-washing & Porta-Potty - S Lamar & Ben White
description:
Handwashing stations and Port-a-Potties that can be used any time of day.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: Texas Harm Reduction Alliance (THRA)
description:
THRA provides harm reduction supplies for safer use, including Narcan, along with overdose prevention education and training. We currently have a drop in center, street outreach, a mobile health clinic, re-entry program, and nightlife outreach.
Services on Wednesdays are for Women only.

This program provides:

- Opioid overdose reversal medication naloxone
- Peer recovery coaching
- Supplies for people who use drugs

We are able to provide peer recovery coaching and linkage to medication assisted treatment, upon request.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: El Buen Samritano Food Pantry
description:
Our food pantry operates as a drive thru where clients arrive at our gates by vehicle or walk-up. Through our valuable partnerships with organizations such as the Austin Diaper Bank and Austin Animal Center we are able to provide additional items to our clients such as diapers and pet food. Pet food is available during pantry hours, while diaper distribution occurs every third Thursday of the month from 8AM – 10AM. Based on availability, we carry newborn to pull-up diapers, women’s hygiene products, and pet food during diaper distribution dates.

Information Updated on: 9/11/2024

name: Bethany Faith Food Pantry
description:
2nd Wednesday 10:00 a.m.-12:00 p.m.
4th Tuesday 6:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m.

Distributing food the second Wednesday 10:00 A.M. to 12:00 noon, and fourth Tuesday 6:00 P.M. - 8:00 P.M.  of each month except for November and December.

name: St. Ignatius Martyr Food Pantry
description:
The Food Pantry is open 9 a.m. - 1 p.m. Monday through Wednesday. The pantry offers free produce and baked goods on Thursdays from 9 a.m. until 11 a.m., or until it runs out.

- We provide dry goods, canned fruits, vegetables and meats.  
- We provide bread and fresh produce as available.
- We provide bus passes, medication vouchers, and some clothing.
- Hospitality coffee and donuts are available outside under the tent.
- Clients are asked to register at the window, and will be called when thier order is ready.
- Clients cannot enter the building under any circumstances.  Restrooms are not available.
- Clients are kindly asked to leave the property once they are served.
- We are compliant with all Central Texas Food Bank and Diocese of Austin directives.


Information Updated: 9/11/2024

name: The Kind Clinic
description:
The Kind Clinic is a full service sexual health and wellness clinic. A program of Texas Health Action, the Kind Clinic provides sexual health services including PrEP and PEP access, STI testing and treatment, HIV testing, and gender affirming care to Central Texans in need. The Kind Clinic strives to provide sexual health services to all members of the LGBTQ community and allies, regardless of race, creed, gender expression, or sexual orientation.
Kind Clinic is closed on all observed holidays and the first Friday of every month.

Information Updated: 9/11/2024

name: LifeWorks - South Austin Youth and Family Resource Center
description:
Provides support services to youth experiencing homelessness. Emergency shelter is provided for youth 18 and younger.  AFSSA helps people escape domestic and sexual violence through safety planning, counseling, access to emergency shelter and housing and other assistance. Services can be provided in various languages. Call the toll-free 24-hour helpline at (877) 281-8371.

name: Alcoholics Anonymous, Hill Country
description:
Alcoholics Anonymous is an international fellowship of men and women who have had a drinking problem. It is nonprofessional, self-supporting, multiracial, apolitical, and available almost everywhere.

Services include:

- Substance abuse support group
- 12-step

name: Sunrise Homeless Navigation Center
description:
Everyday 9am-1pm hot meals are served. Provides coordinated housing assessments, mail services, document storage, mental health consultations, ID help, hygiene supplies, showers, bus passes, MAP signups, and free medical clinic. The Sunrise Hotline phone number is 512-522-1097 and is open Monday through Friday from 9:00 am – 1:00 pm. The Sunrise Hotline provides housing navigation and resources over the phone for individuals and families who are experiencing homelessness in the Austin metro area.

name: Integral Care - Housing, Drug and Alcohol Treatment
description:
Integral Care helps adults who live with mental illness and/or use alcohol or drugs find safe and stable housing. Depending on eligibility, services can include help paying rent and utilities, help with landlords, help getting benefits and disability income, and case management. Integral Care also provides drug and alcohol treatment, employment services, life skills training, nursing care and mental health care. We have permanent housing units in Travis County and offer short-term housing support.

Services are available regardless of ability to pay and can be provided in many languages.

description:

description:

name: Mobile Loaves and Fishes
description:
Provides Lunch and Dinner every day, and Breakfast on Saturday-Mondays. Also provides clothing, hygiene products. Find truck schedules near you on our website.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: Community First! Village
description: Community First! Village is a 51-acre master planned community that provides affordable, permanent housing and a supportive community for men and women coming out of chronic homelessness. A development of Mobile Loaves & Fishes, this transformative residential program exists to love and serve our neighbors who have been living on the streets, while also empowering the surrounding community into a lifestyle of service with the homeless.

name: STD Clinic - Austin/Travis County Health Services
description:
The STD program provides counseling and testing, outreach and education, case management, and HIV surveillance. The STD Clinic at RBJ Health Center provides evaluation, diagnosis, and treatment of sexually transmitted infections. We can only test for Genital Herpes if you have active symptoms.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: Emergency Shelter for Immigrants and Refugees - Casa Marianella
description:
Casa Marianella is an emergency homeless shelter that serves recently-arrived men and women immigrants, asylum seekers, and asylees in East Austin. They set clients on the path towards self-sufficiency and independence as they start their new lives in the United States.

This program provides:

- Emergency shelter (bed, hot shower, laundry, etc.)
- Hot meals
- Men’s and women’s clothing
- Access to computers
- Case management

In addition to these services, Adult House is home to a community center which they provide access to:

- ESL classes
- Legal services for Casa Marianella residents
- Oriental Medicine Clinic

The length of stay ranges from 2 weeks to 3 months.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: Cristo Rey Catholic Church- Social Ministry Food Pantry
description:
Cristo Rey's food pantry serves everyone from low income families, single parents, senior citizens, unemployed individuals, disabled veterans, working poor, and anyone else in need of our assistance.

Services provided to our community include:

- Food to meet basic nutritional needs

Families can visit up to 1 time per week. It is recommended to bring a reusable bag, but not required. We recommend arriving close to opening time, if possible.

Does not provide assistance for rent or utilities, or any type of financial assistance. Does not provide bus passes.

Food pantry is located in the Cristo Rey Center across the street from the church. As of August 1, 2024, the food pantry will open at 12:15 pm until 2:30 or until food runs out.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: X - Pathways at Chalmers Courts South - X Delete
description:
3rd Thursday: 11:30 am-12:30 pm (CSFP ONLY). Healthy Option Program for the Elderly (HOPE) serves adults age 55 and older.

Healthy Option Program for the Elderly (HOPE) serves adults age 55 and older. At any HOPE distribution, clients will receive about 20 pounds of non-perishable food. Exact contents will vary month to month but usually include items such as canned protein, milk, pasta, beans, canned vegetables, and more. Anyone interested in participating but unable to attend a distribution can designate a proxy to pick-up on their behalf. 

For HOPE services, no ID or proof of income are required to receive HOPE. Those who qualify for other food assistance programs may qualify for HOPE. Bring bags or something to transport the groceries; most HOPE sites are unable to provide bags or boxes. For more detailed information or call (855) 366-3401.

name: Planned Parenthood
description:
You can privately and easily book your appointment online for select services 24/7. Health center staff can answer any questions you may have. This program provides:

- Birth Control
- Breast Cancer Screening
- Cervical Cancer Screening
- Gender affirming hormone therapy (for adults with informed consent)
- HIV and Rapid HIV Testing
- HPV Testing and Vaccine
- Menopause management and mid-life care
- Morning-After Pill (Emergency Contraception)
- Pap Test
- Pelvic Exam
- Pregnancy Options
- PREP
- STI Testing
- Urinary Tract Infection Treatment

This program does not provide pregnancy termination services.

Please note that we'll be closed on these holidays: New Year's Day, Martin Luther King Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Day after Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: East Austin Neighborhood Center - Austin Public Health
description:
Austin Public Health offers basic and social services to residents to assist them with their needs and overall success in the community.

This program provides:

- Notary services
- Help you fill out forms and applications
- Bus passes
- Short-term counseling
- Help find a job
- Help you apply for other benefits

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: Public Bathroom
description:
Terrazas Branch, Austin Public Library. Monday-Sunday; 9AM-5PM

name: Angel House Soup Kitchen Program - Austin Baptist Chapel
description:
Angel House Soup Kitchen of Austin Baptist Chapel serves the poor by providing hot meals (breakfast and lunch) seven days a week. This service supplies critical nutrition to those who may otherwise not have access to food to meet their needs.

This program provides:

- Sack breakfast and lunch
- Shower facilities
- Clothing closet for adult men because of space.

Health services by RNs (Registered Nurses)
Check your blood pressure, cholesterol, and blood sugar

Refer you to a doctor or clinic if needed

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: Conley Guerrero Recreation
description: The Conley-Guerrero Senior Activity Center (CGSAC) functions as a recreation and special use resource facility for persons 50 years of age and older. Facilities include a multi-purpose room for large groups and special events, exercise rooms with workout equipment, meeting rooms and a courtyard for members to enjoy the outdoors.

name: Our Lady of Guadalupe Food Pantry
description:
The food pantry serves everyone from low income families, single parents, senior citizens, unemployed individuals, disabled veterans, working poor, undocumented individuals, formerly-incarcerated individuals and anyone else in need of our assistance.

The pantry is available every third Saturday of the month 9:00 am - 11:00 am and every Friday of every month from 10:15 am - 12:30 pm. Food pantry is not open on the last Friday of the month.

Information Updated: 9/13/2024

name: Helping Hand Center - Olivet Baptist Church
description: Helping Hands Center provides grocery bags of nutritional food and places new for those in need. The center not only serves persons living in Austin but outlying areas as well.

name: Church Under the Bridge - Mission Possible
description:
Twice monthly a meal is provided to those who attend CUB by partnering churches. This meal provides a great opportunity to connect and share a meal with all the individuals who call CUB their church home.

Information Updated: 9/14/2024
